poem:
"Mementos of Time's Ebb and Flow"

In the cluttered corner, a talking head
from cyber realms unknown.
Not of this earth nor the next,
but a trophy from an actor's duel -
Flickers of light caught,
in metallic strands and synthetic voice.
Costumes folded, outgrown,
lingering in the quiet dust,
an echo of a fez-less conqueror.
Childlike guile now buried
in the reams of memory's impatient tide.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I’m outacted by a nine-year-old’: Matt Smith on House of the Dragon, chaos and child stars Matt Smith keeps trophies from his acting career. He’s particularly proud of the talking Cyberman head from his breakthrough role as the Eleventh Doctor from 2009 to 2013. “I’ve got my costumes tucked away too. I won’t even fit into them now.” I’m disappointed to learn, though, that Smith didn’t keep the fez that led to the best line Doctor". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘I’m outacted by a nine-year-old’: Matt Smith on House of the Dragon, chaos and child stars Matt Smith keeps trophies from his acting career. He’s particularly proud of the talking Cyberman head from his breakthrough role as the Eleventh Doctor from 2009 to 2013. “I’ve got my costumes tucked away too. I won’t even fit into them now.” I’m disappointed to learn, though, that Smith didn’t keep the fez that led to the best line Doctor
